intro: Polyachyrus annuus, commonly known as the annual chrysanthemum, is an herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and produces daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow, white, and orange. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and a fibrous root system. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden beds and borders. Polyachyrus annuus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can also be used in traditional medicine.
